#summary Get Passes For Template

= Get Passes For Template =

|| *URI* || `https://api.passkit.com/v1/template/`<font color="blue">{templateName}</font>`/passes` <font color="grey"> _/?format=xml_ (optional)</font> ||
|| *Verb* || GET ||
|| *Auth* || Yes ||

This method returns some basic template information and all the passes (pass meta -and field data) that were issued for the given template with <font color="blue">{templateName}</font>.

== URL Parameters ==

  * <font color="blue">*templateName*</font> <font color="green">_(string)_</font> The name of the template

=== cURL Syntax ===

<code>curl --digest -u {APIKey}:{APISecret} "https://api.passkit.com/v1/template/{templateName}/passes"</code>

----

=== Response Parameters ===

==== Template parameters ====

  * *<font color="blue">success</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ Will return <font color="purple">true</font> for a successful submission, or will not be present in the case of an error.
  * *<font color="blue">templateName</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The name of the template.
  * *<font color="blue">templateLastUpdated</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The date when the template was last updated.
  * *<font color="blue">totalPasses</font>* <font color="green">_(int)_</font>
    *_ The total amount of issued passes.
  * *<font color="blue">passRecords</font>* <font color="green">_(array)_</font>
    *_ An array of all the pass records.
  
==== Pass meta-data parameters ====

  * *<font color="blue">passStatus</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The status of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">installIp</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The installation IP address of the device when the pass was installed.
  * *<font color="blue">installIPCountry</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The country that the device was in when the pass was installed.
  * *<font color="blue">installIPCity</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The city that the device was in when the pass installed.
  * *<font color="blue">recoveryURL</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The recovery URL of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">issueDate</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The issue date of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">lastDataChange</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The time when data was last changed on the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">lastPushRefresh</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The time when data was pushed last to the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">lastManualRefresh</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The last time the user did a manual refresh.
  * *<font color="blue">passExpires</font>* <font color="green">_(date)_</font>
    *_ The expiry date of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">passbookSerial</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The PassBook serial of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">uniqueID</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The unique pass-id of the the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">serialNumber</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The serial number of the pass.
  * *<font color="blue">shareID</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_ The share-id of the pass.

==== Pass field-data parameters ====

  * *<font color="blue">{fieldName}</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_Returns the name of each dynamic 'value' field, together with the type of data the field accepts. The type value will be either one of <font color="purple">text</font>, <font color="purple">number</font>,  <font color="purple">date</font>,  <font color="purple">datetime</font> or <font color="purple">currency</font>.
  * *<font color="blue">barcodeContent</font>* <font color="green">_(string)_</font>
    *_If the template allows for the barcode encoded content to be changed, this parameter will be returned with a value of <font color="purple">text</font>
